CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 9, 1960, pg. A7, reads: "Toki Gets a Plaque - During the Jan. 3 gala fashion show - dancing party given at the New Arena by the fashionable D. I. Club to aid the National Foundation's work in research, Charles Bynum, intergroup relations relations director, presented a plaque to Courier women's editor Toki Schalk Johnson for 'distinguished service' to the National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis. Mr. Bynum, who flew from New York for the affair, praised the D. I.s for their fine work in raising money for the Foundation.  Mrs. Johnson is advisor to the club group. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related images published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 9, 1960, pg. A9, reads: "D.I.'s Stage Another Triumph At Arena - Toki Johnson Receives Plaque From Foundation...Mr. Bynum presented a silver and teakwood plaque to Mrs. Toki Schalk  Johnson, Courier woman's editor for distinguished service to the foundation rendered during the years."
TitMainTitle: Toki Schalk Johnson receiving plaque from Charles H. Bynum, on stage in New Arena Supper Club for D. I. Club National Foundation for Infantile Paralysis benefit
